name: Hungarian Waste Management Federation
membership: HOE is a member of the Bureau of International Recycling (BIR), the European Recycling Industries’ Confederation (EuRIC), the European Metal Trade and Recycling Federation (EUROMETREC), the European Recovered Paper Association (ERPA), the Confederation of Hungarian Employers and Industrialists (BUSINESSHUNGARY), and the Hungarian Standards Institution (MSZT).
goal:
The Hungarian Waste Management Federation (Hulladékgazdálkodók Országos Szövetsége, HOSZ) is principally the industry federation of recycling companies in Hungary. The federation has approximately 50 member companies from all the parts of the country. Its members include companies involved in the collection, pre-treatment, and recycling of ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals, recovered paper, waste plastics, waste glass, tyre waste, and waste electrical and electronic equipment and the trading of those recyclables. The membership of the federation includes private companies, companies which are indirectly in the majority ownership of the State or a local government, and waste management public service providers. We are proud that the market share of our members in the domestic trading and recycling of recyclables is more than 80%.

ACTIVITIES
• Taking part in the policy-making process through giving professional opinion on draft legislation related to waste management
• Elaborating analyses and background studies to draft legislation and other programmes concerning waste management
• Providing the members with information on changes to legislation, calls for applications, events and news related to waste management and the market of different wastes on a regular basis
• Membership at the Bureau of International Recycling (BIR), the European Recycling Industries’ Confederation (EuRIC), the European Metal Trade and Recycling Federation (EUROMETREC), and the European Recovered Paper Association (ERPA), and continuous and mutual exchange of information between HOSZ and the umbrella organizations
• Supporting the edition of the monthly professional magazine ZIP
• Holding conferences aiming to encourage recovery and recycling; participating at waste management conferences in Hungary and abroad
• Providing the citizens, public institutions and companies with information on issues related to waste management and helping institutions and companies set up separate waste collection systems
• Organizing courses to scrap yard employees
